data.Title: Google Keeps Third-Party Cookies in Chrome, Relieving Ad Industry
data.Description: After years of uncertainty and industry pushback, Google has decided to retain third-party cookies in its Chrome browser. The move comes as a relief to the ad industry, which had expressed concerns about the impact of cookie deprecation.

data.Title: Google's AI Overviews Get New Features: Link Citations, Saving for Later
data.Description: Google is testing new features for its AI Overviews in search results. These include link icons that cite the source of the AI answer and an option to save AI Overviews for later viewing in the Google Search App.

data.Title: Bing Tests Related Searches at the Top of Search Results
data.Description: Bing is experimenting with the placement of related searches, moving them from the bottom of the search results page to the top, directly under the search bar.

data.Title: Google's Algorithms Combat Negative SEO Attempts
data.Description: Google's algorithms are becoming increasingly sophisticated in detecting and mitigating the impact of negative SEO tactics, ensuring a fairer search ranking landscape.

data.Title: Google Notes on Search Data Export Deadline Approaching
data.Description: Google is reminding users of the approaching deadline to export their Notes on Search data. The feature is being discontinued, and users are encouraged to download their data before it's no longer accessible.

data.Title: Google Using AI for Video Descriptions in Search Results
data.Description: Google is leveraging its AI Overviews technology to generate descriptions for videos appearing in search results, enhancing accessibility and providing users with more context.
